item_widget module

class item_widget.ItemWidget(config, widget_type, initial_value, options, callback, width=50, key=None, text_edit_height=90, verbose=1)[source]

Bases: QWidget

A widget for displaying and editing a single field from a config file.

  • Supports various widget types including editable text, combo boxes, and read-only labels.

  • All user edits are validated and synchronized with the config data.

  • Uses structured_text module to parse text representations of dictionaries and lists.

config

The config file object. Must support get, set, save, load.

Type:

Config

widget_type

The type of widget (“text_edit”, “line_edit”, “read_only”, “label”,

Type:

str

or "combo_box").
key

Key for the field in the config data.

Type:

str

error_style

style for indicating an error.

Type:

str

rgx

Regex pattern for validating text fields. Set in options parameter.

Type:

str

_data_type

data type of the item

Type:

type

Methods:

display()[source]

Load and display our field from the config data. Prints a warning if our key is not found in config data.

set_error_style(widget, message=None)[source]

Apply an error style to the widget.

Parameters:

  • widget (QWidget) – The widget to style.

  • message (str, optional) – Optional error message to display.

set_normal_style(widget)[source]

Restore the widget’s default style.

Parameters:

widget (QWidget) – The widget to restore.

set_text(widget, data)[source]

Update the widget’s text with the provided value.

Parameters:

  • widget (QWidget) – The widget to update.

  • data (str or dict) – The data to display in the widget.

item_widget.get_text(widget)[source]

Retrieve the text value from a widget.

Parameters:

widget (QWidget) – The widget to retrieve the value from.

Returns:

The current text of the widget.

Return type:

str
